method.name: traffic_l47_config
method.description: This generic procedure configures application flows from a set of predefined application flows. This will create, modify and delete appication flows on top of NGPF End Points.

description.text: Mode of the procedure call. Valid options are: create modify delete enable disable get

choice.choiceText: Create only one stream/traffic item.
Modify only one existing stream/traffic item.
Remove/disable an existing stream/traffic item.
Enables an existing stream/traffic item.
Disables an existing stream/traffic item.
Get available flows for existing stream/traffic item.

restriction.value: create modify delete enable disable get

restriction.argumentId: for -mode modify: 'l47_configuration ' | value = 'modify_profile_parameters' / 'modify_flow_percentage' / 'modify_flow_parameter' / 'modify_flow_connection_parameter ' / 'override_flows ' / 'append_flow' / 'remove_flow' / 'distribute_flows_percentage_evenly' for -mode get: 'l47_configuration ' | value = 'get_available_flows'

description.text: Required for -mode modify/remove/enable/disable/get calls. Stream ID returned from the traffic_l47_config handles. Stream ID is not required for configuring a stream for the first time. In this case, the stream ID is returned by the call.. Valid for Application Library Traffic.
Required for -mode modify and -stream_id traffic_item_handler calls Valid for Application Library Traffic.

choice.choiceText: Modify the profile parameter for stream/traffic item.
Modify the flow percentage for a given flow.
Modify the flow parameters for a given flow.
Modify the flow connection parameter for a given flow.
Override flow from existing stream/traffic item.
Add a new flow to existing stream/traffic item.
Remove flow from existing stream/traffic item.
Distribute flow percentage equally among the configured flows in given stream/traffic item.
Get all the configured flows in a given stream/traffic item.

restriction.value: modify_profile_parameters modify_flow_percentage modify_flow_parameter modify_flow_connection_parameter override_flows append_flow remove_flow distribute_flows_percentage_evenly get_available_flows

restriction.argumentId: for -l47_configuration 'modify_profile_parameters': 'objective_type' | 'objective_value' | 'objective_distribution' | 'stream_id' for -l47_configuration 'modify_flow_percentage': 'flow_percentage' | 'stream_id' for -l47_configuration 'modify_flow_parameter': 'parameter_id ' | 'parameter_option' | 'parameter_value' | 'stream_id' for -l47_configuration 'modify_flow_connection_parameter': 'connection_id ' | 'stream_id' for -l47_configuration 'override_flows': 'stream_id ' | 'flow_id' for -l47_configuration 'append_flow': 'stream_id ' | 'flow_id' for -l47_configuration 'remove_flow': 'stream_id' | 'flow_id' for -l47_configuration 'distribute_flows_percentage_evenly': 'stream_id ' for -l47_configuration 'get_available_flows': 'stream_id'

description.text: Stream string identifier/name. If this name contains spaces, the spaces will be translated to underscores and a warning will be displayed. The string name must not contain commas.
This argument can be used to specify the endpoint type that will be used to generate traffic.

choice.choiceText: Select this option if the endpoint supports IPv4 application traffic generation.
Select this option if the endpoint supports IPv6 application traffic generation.

description.text: The handle used to retrieve information for L2 or L3 source addresses and use them to configure the sources for traffic. This should be the emulation handle that was obtained after configuring NGPF protocols. This parameter can be provided with a list or with a list of lists elements.

The handle used to retrieve information for L2 or L3 source addresses and use them to configure the destinations for traffic. This should be the emulation handle that was obtained after configuring NGPF protocols. This parameter can be provided with a list or with a list of lists elements.

An array which contains lists of handles used to retrieve information for L3 src addresses, indexed by the endpointset to which they correspond. This should be a handle that was obtained after configuring protocols with commands from the ::ixia_hlapi_framework:: namespace. This parameter can be used in conjunction with emulation_src_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the index of the first port on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_src_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the number of ports on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_src_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the index of the first interface on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_src_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the number of interfaces on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_src_handle.

An array which contains lists of handles used to retrieve information for L3 dst addresses, indexed by the endpointset to which they correspond. This should be a handle that was obtained after configuring protocols with commands from the ::ixia_hlapi_framework:: namespace. This parameter can be used in conjunction with emulation_dst_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the index of the first port on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_dst_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the number of ports on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_dst_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the index of the first interface on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_dst_handle.

An array which contains lists of numbers that encode the number of interfaces on which the corresponding endpointset will be configured. This parameter will be ignored if no corresponding value is specified for emulation_scalable_dst_handle.
sets objective type.
sets objective value.
sets objective distribution.
enables/disables per IP statistics.
sets flows to be configured when create a traffic application profile.
Amount of traffic to be generated for this flow in percentage.
Name of the Application Library flow ( e.g. HTTP_Request).
Application library flow connection identifier ( e.g. 1).
Application library flow parameter identifier ( e.g. enableProxyPort).
Each parameter has one or multiple options. This options are: value, choice and range.

choice.choiceText: single value. To be used when parameter takes a single value.
choice of values. To be used when parameter takes a value from choice of values.
range of value. To be used when parameter takes a value between range of values.

description.text: For each parameter a value can be assigned. The parameters are runtime specific and can accommodate the following types:

choice.choiceText: when the value is in number format
when the value is a boolean value, true or false
when the value is a word
when the value is in hex format
when the value is selected from a list of available options
when specifying a range value, this value must be in format min-max, where min and max are numeric values

restriction.value: numeric bool string hex choice range

returnValue.value: On status of failure, gives detailed information.
A list containing the handles of L47 traffic items that were added by the command (if any). This key is returned only when the command is issued with -mode create.
This key returns the list of initiator ports configured in the traffic item mentioned by <traffic_l47_handle>.
This key returns the list of responder ports configured in the traffic item mentioned by <traffic_l47_handle>.
This key returns the applib handle configured in the traffic item mentioned by <traffic_l47_handle>.
This key returns the applib flows configured in the traffic item mentioned by <traffic_l47_handle> and the AppLib profile mentioned by the <applib_profile> handle.
A list of the available flows. This key is returned only when the command is issued with -mode get.

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::traffic_l47_config
# This command will configure a L47 application traffic between two NGPF EndPoint
set traffic_item_1_status [::ixiangpf::traffic_l47_config \ -mode create \ -name Traffic_Item_1 \ -circuit_endpoint_type ipv4_application_traffic \ -emulation_src_handle <topology_1_handle> \ -emulation_dst_handle <topology_2_handle> \ -objective_type users \ -objective_value 100 \ -objective_distribution apply_full_objective_to_each_port \ -enable_per_ip_stats 1 \ -flows <flows> \ ]
# This command will generate output sa given # {status 1} {traffic_l47_handle trafficL47Handle} {trafficL47Handle # {{applib_profile appLibProfileHandle} {appLibProfileHandle {{applib_flow <flows>}}} # {initiator_ports {<port>}} {responder_ports {<port>}}}}

# Command :- ixiangpf.traffic_l47_config # This command will configure a L47 application traffic between two NGPF EndPoint
status = ixiangpf.traffic_l47_config( mode = "create", name = "Traffic_Item_1", circuit_endpoint_type = "ipv4_application_traffic", emulation_src_handle = "<topology_1_handle>", emulation_dst_handle = "<topology_2_handle>", objective_type = "users", objective_value = "100", objective_distribution = "apply_full_objective_to_each_port", enable_per_ip_stats = "1", flows = "<flows>", ) # This command will generate output sa given # {'status' : '1', 'traffic_l47_handle' : 'trafficL47Handle', 'trafficL47Handle' : # {'applib_profile' : 'appLibProfileHandle', 'appLibProfileHandle' : {'applib_flow' : '<flows>'} # 'initiator_ports' : '<port>', 'responder_ports' : '<port>'}}

# Command :- ixiangpf::traffic_l47_config # This command will configure a L47 application traffic between two NGPF EndPoint my $traffic_item_1_status = ixiangpf::traffic_l47_config ({ mode => "create", name => "Traffic_Item_1", circuit_endpoint_type => "ipv4_application_traffic", emulation_src_handle => "<topology_1_handle>", emulation_dst_handle => "<topology_2_handle>", objective_type => "users", objective_value => "100", objective_distribution => "apply_full_objective_to_each_port", enable_per_ip_stats => "1", flows => "<flows>", }); # This command will generate output sa given # {status 1} {traffic_l47_handle trafficL47Handle} {trafficL47Handle # {{applib_profile appLibProfileHandle} {appLibProfileHandle {{applib_flow <flows>}}} # {initiator_ports {<port>}} {responder_ports {<port>}}}}
